casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Deshawn Dupree SMITH, Appellant. WD 80199 Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District. ORDER FILED: April 10, 2018 Joshua D. Hawley, Attorney General, and Gregory L. Barnes and Dora A. Fichter, Assistant Attorneys General, Jefferson City, MO, Attorneys for Respondent. Margaret M. Johnston and Casey A. Taylor, Assistant Public Defenders, Columbia, MO, Attorneys for Appellant. Before Special Division: Zel M. Fischer, Special Judge, Presiding, and Alok Ahuja and Karen King Mitchell, Judges

Order

Per Curiam:

Deshawn Dupree Smith appeals, following a jury trial, his convictions of attempted first-degree robbery (§§ 564.011 and 569.020), first-degree robbery (§ 569.020), and armed criminal action (§ 571.015), for which he was sentenced as a persistent felony offender to concurrent terms of ten, twenty, and ten years' imprisonment, respectively. Smith brings two points on appeal. Finding no error of law, we affirm. Rule 30.25(b).
